"Ninjitsu?!"
"It's just Kicker with extra steps"
Got me good with that one. The reference wasn't lost on me (as I fear it may have been for many).
Simic value engine with no real win con gets me every time.

comments_since_last_sample.body: So... every thing that is optional to do has a cost and benefit, like the kicker mechanic.

Let's see if what he claims is true by going down the list of original Ravnica mechanics

Forecast: The forecast effect is the real spell and the "real spell" is the kicker
Haunt: You sacrifice the creature and another creature to get the effect again
Radiance: This one is definitely not kicker
Convoke: The kicker cost is tapping permanents to lower the spell's cost
Transmute: The logic he used for cycling applies here, but honestly I think it's bullshit
Replicate: You pay the kicker cost and you get extra copies
Graft: You pay a kicker cost of removing counters from permanents with graft to put them on the creature
Hellbent: Sometimes you get an additional ability if you have no cards in hand
Dredge: This is definitely not kicker unless you want to say it's kicker for card draw
Bloodthirst: The kicker cost is having to do damage to the opponent that turn
When you realize he has a point...
MTG CONFLUX PODCAST GOT THERE FIRST !!!
Was about to bring up islandwalk until the horsemanship point came up. So islandwalk is horsemanship then.
